intro: Oxytropis konlonica, commonly known as Konlon's locoweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its upright growth habit and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish to greenish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Oxytropis konlonica is also known for its toxic properties, containing alkaloids that can be harmful to livestock.
